questions.text: Whom did Savant and Mister Majestic not recruit for their new team?
questions.explanation:
Maul.

	Mister Majestic and Savant thought that the rest of the team were dead, Maul among them. They recruited the sharpshooting Condition Red, the cyborg Ladytron, and the intelligent genetically-engineered human Tactically Augmented Organism, also known as T.A.O. The three were introduced in "WildC.A.T.s" #21, which went on sale in 1995.

questions.text: Which team member did not make the initial visit to Khera?
questions.explanation:
Grifter.

	Grifter had left the team by the time the trip to Khera was completed. A marksman like his brother Condition Red, he rejoins the team in the midst of a huge crime wave. Grifter first appeared in "WildC.A.T.s" #1, which debuted in 1992.

questions.text: Lord Emp and Zealot were the two WildC.A.T.s running for the Kheran Senate.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Zealot, who insisted on going by her given name of Lady Zannah, represented theCoda while the immortal dwarf Lord Emp represented the Pantheon. Both parties sought a majority in the Senate. Both Lord Emp and Zealot first appeared in the first issue of "WildC.A.T.s", which debuted in 1992.

questions.text: Spartan used to pretend to be a human named:
questions.explanation:
John Colt & Colt.

	John Colt was a famous adventurer in the 1930's whose mind was transferred to a robot. In reality, John Colt was a Kherubim fighter named Yohn Kohl. He first appeared in "WildC.A.T.s" #1 in 1992.

questions.text: Whom did Ladytron attempt to woo?
questions.explanation:
Condition Red.

	Condition Red found her a tad creepy, and waved off her repeated attempts. She was ruthless, even prompting Condition Red to check himself out of the hospital in order to escape her advances. Both characters appeared for the first time in the twenty-first issue of "WildC.A.T.s", which went on sale in 1995. Before joining the team, they both used to be criminals.

T.A.O.

	T.A.O. used his intelligence and his talent for manipulation to engage the team in a widescale crime war, and also made Savant fall in love with him. He first appeared in a holding pen in "WildC.A.T.s" #21, which debuted in 1995.

Grifter.

	Condition Red was trying to shoot T.A.O., who disappeared at the last second, leaving Savant in his wake. Savant eventually made a full recovery. The accidental shooting took place in "WildC.A.T.s" #34, which went on sale in 1996.

questions.text: Maul can increase his size and strength, but what happens as he grows in size?
options: He loses the ability to fly
questions.explanation:
His intelligence decreases.

	Maul is actually Jeremy Stone, an intelligent scientist who won the Nobel prize. He is a human-Titanthrope hybrid, and has the powers of all Titanthropes. He first appeared in "WildC.A.T.s" #1, which went on sale in 1992.

questions.text: Who sacrifices herself to save Khera from a bomb?
questions.explanation:
Glingo.

	Glingo was a Titanthrope who lived on Khera and fought for the rights of her people. She was also briefly romantically involved with Maul. She died ijn "WildC.A.T.s" #28, which went on sale in 1996.

questions.text: As a result of T.A.O.'s manipulations, whose mind was shattered?
questions.explanation:
Fuji's mind.

	Fuji is a member of the rival superteam Stormwatch. He has great strength, but only exists in a gaseous form. He first appeared "Stormwatch" #1, which went on sale in 1993.
